message: Not here.
Looks like Thomas still hasn't come back from the brothel.
Well, with that body, I bet he's way more energetic than me... He's probably planning to stay all night.

name: Thomas
message: That was fast.
So, how was it? The taste of a widow?

name: Jonathan
message: You can let your imagination run wild if you want, but Hudson-san is a proper lady, you know.

name: Thomas
message: You're still wet behind the ears.
Women are all the same, no matter who they are.

name: Jonathan
message: Do whatever you want.

name: Thomas
message: Well, that stuff can wait till later.
If we don't hurry up, the sun's gonna come up.

name: Jonathan
message: Where are you planning on taking me？

name: Thomas
message: That's something to look forward to after we get there.
Are you feeling okay？

name: Jonathan
message: I'm totally fine now.

name: Thomas
message: That's great.
We finally get to have some fun, but the one thing we need most is totally useless... that's just too much.

name: Thomas
message: Yo, you alright？
I gotta admit, I was pretty shocked when you collapsed at the monastery.

name: Jonathan
message: 君と教授が運んでくれたのかい？
I　really　caused　you　a　lot　of　trouble,　sorry.

name: Thomas
message: Nah, don’t worry about it.
More importantly, I'm glad I made it in time. I was just about to head out.

name: Jonathan
message: Where are you planning to take me？

name: Thomas
message: Whoa, whoa, don't get so worked up.
For a shitty countryside, it's not so damn bad after all.

name: Jonathan
message: What the hell do you mean, 'It's not all worthless'？

name: Thomas
message: Well then, shall we head out？
If you take it too slow, the sun'll come up before you know it.

name: Jonathan
message: Yeah, I'm a busy guy too.
If I don't hurry up and get this over with, my body won't last.

name: Thomas
message: Well, do you really think it'll go that smoothly？
My gut tells me, you're the type to get hooked pretty hard.

name: Jonathan
message: What about？

name: Thomas
message: See ya, wild thing‥‥‥‥‥
Sometimes, being 'the one getting served...' ain't so bad.

name: Jonathan
message: I have no idea what you're talking about.

name: Thomas
message: Well, it's all good.
Alright, let's head out.

name: Jonathan
message: Wait a sec, I've got an appointment to meet Mrs. Hudson.

name: Thomas
message: You and the lady？
Hey,　hey……　You’re　pretty　good,　aren’t　you?

name: Jonathan
message: That's not it！
The professor mentioned it this morning, right? That his wife was pissed off at me.

name: Thomas
message: Ah, that, huh......

name: Jonathan
message: It'll be done soon, so just wait for me.

name: Thomas
message: No need to rush. If you think about why the lady’s getting mad, it’s not like there’s zero chance for you, right?

name: Jonathan
message: What's your reason, huh？
The lady is worried about Cordelia. She thinks it'd be a huge problem if people started saying her daughter's a slacker.

name: Thomas
message: Is that really true？
いくら貞淑な未亡人だって、何年も独り身じゃ辛いだろ。

name: Thomas
message: Then, a young man showed up from London.
どうせ長いこと村にいる訳でもなし、後腐れがねえ。

name: Thomas
message: Wouldn't be strange if you got a bit of a sense of adventure.
Are you the type who gets liked by older women？

name: Jonathan
message: Cut it out already！
The lady's not that kind of person.

name: Thomas
message: Got it, don't get so worked up.
Anyway, just go already, I'll be waiting for you.
This room is on the shady backside, so it's weirdly damp and honestly not all that comfortable.
Considering the awkward relationship between Thomas and Mrs. Hudson, maybe she gave Thomas this lousy room on purpose.

Mrs. Hudson, who's always gentle and doesn't have a trace of slyness, just doesn't seem like the type to do something like that, but I honestly can't think of a reason why she would've gone out of her way to stick Thomas, who'd been staying here at the Fish Scale Inn even before I decided to, in such a lousy room.
Thomas's room is just as tidy as he claims to like things clean, everything is neatly organized.
そればかりか、この部屋にはトマスが滞在しているという事を伝えるような荷物や衣服の類が一切存在しない。
Is this how his secret society does things?
Even if I try to snoop around the room while Thomas isn't here, there's no way I'd find anything like this.
Maybe they keep things light around them so they can disappear at any time.
I wonder how Thomas found out there's a brothel in this village.
酒場と娼婦と葬儀屋はどんな場所にもあると言うが、誰がトマスにその場所を教えたんだ？
It's not much different from the Bed in my room.
It might be a little too small for tall Thomas.
The sheet is just as Mrs. Hudson made the bed, neatly arranged without a single wrinkle.
He's probably planning to spend the night in the prostitute's room again until morning.
No matter how nicely Mrs. Hudson makes the bed, it doesn't mean a thing.
Thomas sure puts up with a room as gloomy as this one.
It's night now so I can't tell, but since it's at the back of the Fish Scale Inn that's in the shade even during the day, sunlight pretty much never comes in through this window.
Doesn't seem like it would make much difference even if the curtain was open.
Thomas sure puts up with a lot, being stuck in a room like this.
It's an old, worthless table, just like the one in my room.
It might've been here as equipment ever since the Fish Scale Inn first opened.
私の部屋にある物と大した変わりはない。
It's too high to eat at, and it seems too tall to use as a writing desk.
Well, Thomas isn't the type to write things down eagerly, and he probably wouldn't want to eat alone either.
Even though there's a Table, you probably hardly use it at all.
Something like this is just right for that guy.
My own room
